thread.title: Restaurant inspections: Montgomery County Health Inspections
thread.title_full: Restaurant inspections: Montgomery County Health Inspections | www.daytondailynews.com

author: Freelancer
title: Restaurant inspections: Montgomery County Health Inspections
text:
The following are a sampling of food operation inspection reports from Public Health – Dayton & Montgomery County, from the week of Sept. 14-18. View full inspections reports at inspections.phdmc.org.
Jimmy’s Italian Kitchen
3002 Woodman Drive, Kettering
Date of inspection: Sept. 14
Violations: Observed wiping cloths not held in a sanitizer bucket. Cloths that are in use for wiping counters and other equipment surfaces shall be held between uses in a chemical sanitizer solution. A sanitizer bucket was provided during the time of inspection.
Observed diced tomatoes held at 50F in a reach-in cooler. Refrigerated time/temperature control for safety (TCS) foods shall be maintained at 41F or below to prevent potential microbial growth. Diced tomatoes were discarded during the time of inspection.
Comments: Ensure the order of: wash, rinse, sanitizer is adequately followed during warewashing.
Clean the ventilation exhaust above the preparation area.
Ensure the can opener is adequately clean.
Pat’s Lido Club
4308 Springfield St., Dayton
Date of inspection: Sept. 14
Violations: Men’s restroom does not have door. Restrooms must have sealed doors to ensure an enclosed area. Door to be installed.
Presence of fruit flies at three-compartment sink and observed in bar area. Pest harborage conditions must be eliminated in order to prevent contamination of foods and service items.
Cadillac Jacks
7720 Old Troy Pike, Huber Heights
Date of inspection: Sept. 14
Violations: Found the sides of the fryers with build up. Clean and maintain to limit potential pest attraction.
Found several floor tiles damaged in the walk in cooler. Repair or replace to ensure proper cleaning to limit bacterial growth.
Comments: Discussed date marking procedures.
Observed quat sanitizers between 200-400ppm.
McDonald’s
1800 Dorothy Lane, Dayton
Date of inspection: Sept. 15
Violations: Observed sliced ham in cooler storage without a lid on the container. Foods must be protected from cross-contamination by keeping containers covered. Lid provided for ham container during the inspection.
Two wet wiping cloths stored out of the sanitizer solution. Wet wiping cloths must be stored in a sanitizing solution between uses. Towels relocated to sanitizing solution during the inspection.
Pan of sausage gravy cooling in the walk-in at an internal temperature of 54.9F. According to management, gravy was pulled from dry stock and put in the walk-in at 11 AM. Canned foods stored in dry stock, once opened, has 4-hours to cool from ambient temperatures to 41F or below. Gravy was pulled for ice water bath to rapidly decrease the temperature to 41F or below.
Comments: Will conduct a re-inspection on or around 9/22/15.
Lo-temp, chemical sanitizing warewash machine: chlorine concentration: 100ppm.
